newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil sells 182-day bonds at weekly auction.
newsitem.headline: Brazil sells 182-day bonds at weekly auction.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank sold 5.714 billion reais in 56-day and 182-day Central Bank Bonds (BBCs) at its weekly formal bond auction Tuesday, dealers said.
It was the first time the Central Bank put 182-day BBCs on sale.
The Central Bank sold 4.357 billion reais in 56-day bonds at an overnight rate of 2.5596 percent a month, down from 2.6385 percent last auction.
The 182-day bonds were sold at 2.411 percent a month, totalling 1.357 billion reais.
The auction's result was seen as positive by the market as the government attempts to increase the maturity period of Brazil's public debt, dealers said.
The finnacial result of the auction indicated 786 million reais will be added to the banking system since 6.5 billion reais in 56-day old bonds coming due Wednesday.
